results.title: Ezra Pound: poets' poet
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: Uses historic photographs, early documentary footage and the poet’s own recollections to explore the life of Ezra Pound. Born in Idaho, he spent his boyhood in Philadelphia, before moving to England. Other aspects of his life covered in this film are his asociation in Paris in the 1920s with other expatriates, such as Joyce, Stein and Hemingway, and his love affair with Rapallo and Venice. Some of the moods evoked by Pound’s poetry are highlighted. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Ezra Jack Keats (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: This film introduces the personality and style of Ezra Jack Keats, Caldecott Medallist, author and illustrator of well-known picture books. It concludes with an iconographic film rendition of one of his books “A Letter to Amy”.

results.title: Eye of an artist
results.creator_credit: Harry Webb and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An artist explains how he sees the framework of a painting, how he develops the angles and how he envisages the end result. Shows examples of his work.

results.title: Extraordinary American films produced between 1899-1908
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.
Contents: Love and war (prod: James H. White, 1899)—The Girl from Montana (prod: William N. Selig, 1907)—His first ride (prod: William N. Selig, 1907)—The Bandit ring (prod: William N. Selig, 1907)—The Bank robbery (prod: Oklahoma Natural Mutoscene Company, 1908)

results.title: Expressionism
results.creator_credit: George Barford, Egons Tomsons and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Traces the development of the basically German Expressionist Movement which exaggerated both color and form to express emotional and psychological attitudes. Includes the work of Munch, Kirchner, Heckel, Schmidt-Rottluff, Nolde, Pechstein, Kokoschka, Bdckmann, Kandinsky, Marc and Klee. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Export action. no. 39
results.brief_description: Part of a series encouraging Australian manufactures to pursue export markets. Examines the case of a West Australian pyjama manufacturer who, with government assistance, broke into the Malaysian and Singaporean pyjama markets.

results.title: Exploring New Zealand's fiordland
results.creator_credit: Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A joint expedition of New Zealand and American research workers into New Zealand’s fiordlands to study fauna and flora and to prepare maps of the area. Narrated by Briton Chadwick.

results.title: Exploring mathematics. Lost in the mish-mosh: area measure
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon in which Finite Sums and Dr Whatsup rescue a professor by solving a problem of area measure. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Exploring in space: the Van Allen radiation belts
results.creator_credit: Charles Probst and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dr James Van Allen and other scientists explain some of the purposes and methods of obtaining information in exploratory space flights. Uses animated drawings, models and live photography to visualise the relationships between the earth, the sun, the magnetosphere, and the radiation belts, and to explain how radio equipped space craft explore the radiation regions.
